content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: EPOCH
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value: $ta_epoch
    - name: EPOCH
      operator: non_empty
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0009
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when EPOCH is not in TA.EPOCH
Operations:
  - domain: TA
    id: $ta_epoch
    name: EPOCH
    operator: distinct
Outcome:
  Message: EPOCH is not in TA.EPOCH
  Output Variables:
    - EPOCH
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0009
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: EPOCH may be included as a timing variable as in other
                  general-observation-class domains. In DS, EPOCH is based on DSSTDTC.
                  The values of EPOCH are drawn from the Trial Arms(TA) dataset (Section
                  7.2.1, Trial Arms).
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: DS, Assumption 4.c
                Section: 6.2.3
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0009
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: EPOCH may be included as a timing variable as in other
                  general-observation-class domains. In DS, EPOCH is based on DSSTDTC.
                  The values of EPOCH are drawn from the Trial Arms (TA) dataset (Section
                  7.2.1, Trial Arms).
                Document: SDTMIG v3.3
                Item: DS, Assumption 4.c
                Section: 6.2.3
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0009
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: '...EPOCH, as a Timing variable, is the name of the
                  Epoch during which --STDTC or --DTC falls. The values of EPOCH are
                  drawn from the Trial Arms domain, Section 7.2 - Experimental Design
                  Trial Arms (TA)'
                Document: SDTMIG v3.2
                Item: DS, Assumption 3.c
                Section: '6.2'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Raise an error when EPOCH is not in TA.EPOCH

Citations.Cited_Guidance: EPOCH may be included as a timing variable as in other general-observation-class domains. In DS, EPOCH is based on DSSTDTC. The values of EPOCH are drawn from the Trial Arms(TA) dataset (Section 7.2.1, Trial Arms).

EPOCH may be included as a timing variable as in other general-observation-class domains. In DS, EPOCH is based on DSSTDTC. The values of EPOCH are drawn from the Trial Arms (TA) dataset (Section 7.2.1, Trial Arms).

...EPOCH, as a Timing variable, is the name of the Epoch during which --STDTC or --DTC falls. The values of EPOCH are drawn from the Trial Arms domain, Section 7.2 - Experimental Design Trial Arms (TA)
